snippet: The indiscriminate use of noncompete clauses hurts workers by limiting their ability to seek better jobs in their chosen professions.
abstract: Editorial warns some employers are imposing noncompete clauses on all kinds of workers, including lower-wage employees; contends indiscriminate use of such clauses hurts workers by limiting their ability to seek better jobs; notes some states like California and North Dakota do not enforce the clauses due to the harm they cause both to individuals and the economy as a whole.
lead_paragraph: The indiscriminate use of noncompete clauses hurts workers by limiting their ability to seek better jobs in their chosen professions.
